frameDefinitions: In this frame either a Stimulus brings about a particular emotion or experience in the Experiencer or  saliently fails to bring about a particular experience.
The words of this frame describe how a Resource_controller spends money or other Resources for a particular purpose .
A Figure is located essentially at the same location as a Ground, which is viewed as point-like, or having no important internal or external structure.
An Earner receives Earnings by providing Goods to a Buyer; providing the Goods also generally entails a cost, which may or may not be included in the consideration.
The Borrower takes possession of a Theme with the knowledge that the Borrower will have to give the Theme back to the Lender after a Duration of time.
An Agent expends effort towards achieving a Goal.
frameExamples: This reflects the 15 % jump in <t><fex name='Earnings'>earnings</fex></t> over 1994 .
I am <t>borrowing</t> the book about modal particles from the professor.
In addition, our organization will <t>work</t> on improving accountability in every department.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the object or event which brings about the emotion in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The <fen>Resource_controller</fen> is the individual whose frugality or generosity is being described. Person typically occurs as the External Argument or, in some cases when <fen>Behavior</fen> is also expressed, in an <ment>of</ment>-PP:
Some specific <fen>Behavior</fen> may be described as frugal or extravagant, rather than attributing the characteristic directly to the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
This role is the resource which the <fen>Resource_controller</fen> expends.
The <fen>Ground</fen> serves as a basis for describing the location of the <fen>Figure</fen>.
The <fen>Figure</fen> is perceived as located relative to a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location. The <fen>Figure</fen> can be an entity or an event.
The period of time during which the locative relation between <fen>Figure</fen> and <fen>Ground</fen> obtains.
The <fen>Earner</fen> is involved in a transaction or set of transactions as the party that receives payment.
<fen>Earnings</fen> are the money given to the <fen>Earner</fen> in a transaction, generally in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Earner</fen> makes their <fen>Earnings</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Earner</fen> makes their <fen>Earnings</fen>.
The person who receives the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The person or institution who gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The object that the <fen>Borrower</fen> receives from the <fen>Lender</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
When the borrowing even occurs.
The location in which the <fen>Borrower</fen> gets the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> puts effort into reaching <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> expends effort to achieve.
An entity that is centrally involved in the <fen>Goal</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> is attempting to acheive.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the effort occurs.
The place where the work is done.
listRoleExamples: It's thrifty of Jo <fex>to re-use teabags</fex>.
He was at my shop <fex>on Friday</fex>.
She made a lot of money <fex>in Africa</fex> .
<fex>Tracy</fex> borrowed that book from Leonard last week.
Tracy borrowed that book <fex>from Leonard</fex> last week.
I am borrowing his car <fex>at the airport</fex>.
